newsitem.title: DENMARK: Dow rally seen pushing Danish shares to new record.
newsitem.headline: Dow rally seen pushing Danish shares to new record.

text.p: Danish share prices rose in early trade on Friday and dealers said strong interest in blue chips and Thursday's Wall Street gains were likely to send Danish stocks to a record close for the fourth day running.
"They will continue to rise and it looks as if interest will focus again on A.P.Moeller, Novo Nordisk and bank shares," a dealer said.

At 0745 GMT the KFX top-20 index was up 0.16 point to 166.01 while its June future rose 1.75 point to 166.75. A.P.Moeller's D/S 1912 rose 1,587.5 crowns to 235,587.5 but sister D/S Svendborg was untraded at 329,333 crowns.

Novo edged up two crowns to 720.00. Den Danske Bank was unchanged from Wednesday's closing 620 crowns, Unidanmark was up two crowns to 355.00 and BG Bank rose a single crown, to 315.00. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969650
